GapFillInput.Instruction: Complete the sentences with an appropriate continuous form. Three sentences require a simple form. Which are they?

Content.Question:
1. My brother and I are staying (stay) with our grandparents when our parents go to Greece next week.
2. It was 7 a.m. this morning, and my mother was still packing (still / pack) to go on her business trip to
Japan.
3. Wherever you travel in the world nowadays, everyone seems to know (know) about
celebrity footballers like David Beckham.
4. Our flight kept getting delayed longer and longer, and the children were getting|got (get) more and
more restless.
5. Professor Smith has been researching (research) the effects of globalisation for five years and has discovered some interesting facts.
6. Aaron and Kate have been spending (spend) time over the last few months trying to change their way of life.
7. Everyone seems to be using (be use) mobile phones to text friends and family nowadays.
8. Every year in January I write a list where I try (try) to think of some interesting new things to start that year like learning the piano.
9. When you get off the plane, we'll be waiting (wait) for you in the terminal.
10. Lots of people seem to prefer (prefer) staying in on a Saturday night with a takeaway meal
and a good DVD!
